result.execSummary:
The defendant Waymon T Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, or any body armor.
No contact with coactor Severuan Armstrong or with Walgreens at 6707 W. Hampton Ave., Milwaukee WI. 53218.
--May have contact with Anthony Poorman.

supervisions.notes:
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under S. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pay DNA surcharge.
To be collected by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 4/17/2021. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Court waives other costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to the amount of restitution owed.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. spc
Count 1
Original SENTENCING Transcript (36 pages) commencing AUGUST 17, 2016 received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.

Defendant Waymon T Green in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Defendant Waymon T Green in custody.  Michael Lonski on behalf of Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Additional statements made by Defendant's Sister, Mother and Grandmother. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 56 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 491 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 26 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 30 MONTHS.  

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

- Court WAIVES costs, fees, assessments and surcharges due to the amount of restitution owed. Defendant DOES have to pay the DNA surcharge, which can be collected by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 04/17/2021; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing. 
- Seek/Maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons or any body armor.
- Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $1,200.00 made payable to Walgreens. 
- Defendant to have no contact with co-actor Severuan Armstrong or with Walgreens at 6707 W. Hampton Ave. Milwaukee WI 53218. 
- Defendant MAY have contact with Anthony Poorman. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting; Notice & Acknowledgement; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
